description: Borrowed from Middle French tactile, from Latin tactilis (“that may be touched, tangible”), from tangere (“to touch”).

adjectives.description: tactile (comparative more tactile, superlative most tactile)

entries.meaning: Tangible; perceptible to the sense of touch.
Of or relating to the sense of touch.
examples: The delicacy of the tactile sense varies on different parts of the skin; it is greatest on the forehead, temples and back of the forearm.
